data.HPO_term_definition: An abnormality of the kidney.
data.HPO_term_synonyms: Abnormality of the kidney, Renal anomaly, Abnormal kidney, Renal anomalies

data.HPO_term_definition: A height above that which is expected according to age and gender norms.
data.HPO_term_synonyms: Increased linear growth, Tall stature, Accelerated linear growth, Increased body height

data.HPO_term_definition: A phenotypic abnormality.
data.HPO_term_synonyms: Organ abnormality

data.HPO_term_definition: The presence of any abnormality of the genitourinary system.
data.HPO_term_synonyms: Genitourinary dysplasia, Genitourinary tract anomalies, Genitourinary tract malformation, Genitourinary disease, Abnormality of the GU system, Urogenital anomalies, Genitourinary abnormality, Urogenital abnormalities

data.HPO_term_definition: The presence of a cleft in the oral cavity, the two main types of which are cleft lip and cleft palate. In cleft lip, there is the congenital failure of the maxillary and median nasal processes to fuse, forming a groove or fissure in the lip. In cleft palate, there is a congenital failure of the palate to fuse properly, forming a grooved depression or fissure in the roof of the mouth. Clefts of the lip and palate can occur individually or together. It is preferable to code each defect separately.
data.HPO_term_synonyms: Cleft lip, cleft palate, Oral clefting, Cleft of the mouth, Cleft lip/palate

data.HPO_term_definition: Head circumference below 2 standard deviations below the mean for age and gender.
data.HPO_term_synonyms: Small head, Reduced head circumference, Small head circumference, Small skull, Decreased circumference of cranium, small cranium, Decreased size of skull, small calvarium, Decreased size of head, Abnormally small head, Abnormally small skull, Decreased size of cranium, Abnormally small cranium

data.HPO_term_definition: Occipitofrontal (head) circumference greater than 97th centile compared to appropriate, age matched, sex-matched normal standards. Alternatively, a apparently increased size of the cranium.
data.HPO_term_synonyms: Large cranium, Large skull, Increased size of head, Big calvaria, Large calvaria, Megacephaly, Macrocrania, Increased size of cranium, Big skull, Increased size of skull, Large head, Big cranium, Large head circumference, Big head

data.HPO_term_definition: A decreased magnitude of the sensory perception of sound.
data.HPO_term_synonyms: Deafness, Hearing impairment, Hypacusis, Hearing defect, Hearing loss, Hypoacusis

data.HPO_term_definition: Any abnormality of the eye, including location, spacing, and intraocular abnormalities.
data.HPO_term_synonyms: Eye disease, Abnormal eye, Abnormality of the eye

data.HPO_term_definition: An abnormality of the nervous system.
data.HPO_term_synonyms: Abnormality of the nervous system, Neurologic abnormalities, Neurological abnormality, Brain and/or spinal cord issue

data.HPO_term_definition: An abnormality of mental functioning including various affective, behavioural, cognitive and perceptual abnormalities.
data.HPO_term_synonyms: Behavioral abnormality, Behavioral symptoms, Behavioural/Psychiatric abnormality, Psychiatric disorders, Behavioral problems, Behavioral disturbances, Behavioral disorders, Psychiatric disturbances, Behavioral changes, Behavioral/psychiatric abnormalities

data.HPO_term_definition: An abnormality of the endocrine system.
data.HPO_term_synonyms: Endocrine system disease

data.HPO_term_definition: An abnormality of the skeletal system.
data.HPO_term_synonyms: Skeletal abnormalities, Skeletal anomalies, Abnormality of the skeletal system

data.HPO_term_definition: Subnormal intellectual functioning which originates during the developmental period. Intellectual disability, previously referred to as mental retardation, has been defined as an IQ score below 70.
data.HPO_term_synonyms: Poor school performance, Nonprogressive mental retardation, Low intelligence, Mental retardation, nonspecific, Dull intelligence, Intellectual disability, Mental deficiency, Mental retardation, Mental-retardation, Nonprogressive intellectual disability

data.HPO_term_definition: A seizure is an intermittent abnormality of nervous system physiology characterised by a transient occurrence of signs and/or symptoms due to abnormal excessive or synchronous neuronal activity in the brain.
data.HPO_term_synonyms: Epilepsy, Seizure, Seizures

data.HPO_term_definition: Mild intellectual disability is defined as an intelligence quotient (IQ) in the range of 50-69.
data.HPO_term_synonyms: Intellectual disability, mild, Mild mental retardation, Mental retardation, borderline-mild, Mild and nonprogressive mental retardation, Mental retardation, mild

data.HPO_term_definition: Accumulation of substantial excess body fat.
data.HPO_term_synonyms: Having too much body fat, Obesity

data.HPO_term_definition: Excessive postnatal growth which may comprise increased weight, increased length, and/or increased head circumference.
data.HPO_term_synonyms: General overgrowth, Generalized overgrowth, Fetal overgrowth

data.HPO_term_definition: An abnormality of the integument, which consists of the skin and the superficial fascia.
data.HPO_term_synonyms: An abnormality of the integument, which consists of the skin and the superficial fascia

data.HPO_term_definition: Any structural anomaly of the heart.
data.HPO_term_synonyms: Abnormality of the heart, Congenital heart defects, Congenital heart defect, Cardiac anomalies, Abnormally shaped heart, Abnormality of cardiac morphology, Cardiac abnormality

data.HPO_term: Abnormality of blood and blood-forming tissues
data.HPO_term_definition: An abnormality of the hematopoietic system.
data.HPO_term_synonyms: Hematological abnormality, Abnormality of the haematopoietic system, Hematologic disease, Abnormality of the hematopoietic system, Abnormality of blood and blood-forming tissues

data.HPO_term_definition: NA
data.HPO_term_synonyms: Laboratory abnormality, Metabolism abnormality

data.HPO_term_definition: An abnormal morphology (form) of the face or its components.
data.HPO_term_synonyms: Malformation of face, Abnormal morphology of the face, Distortion of face, Unusual facies, Funny looking face, Deformity of face, Dysmorphic facies, Dysmorphic facial features, Distinctive facies, Facial dysmorphism, Abnormal facial shape, Unusual facial appearance

data.HPO_term_definition: A structural abnormality of the central nervous system.
data.HPO_term_synonyms: Morphological abnormality of the central nervous system

data.HPO_term_definition: Profound mental retardation is defined as an intelligence quotient (IQ) below 20.
data.HPO_term_synonyms: Mental retardation, profound, IQ less than 20, Profound mental retardation

data.HPO_term: Abnormality of the autonomic nervous system
data.HPO_term_definition: An abnormality of the autonomic nervous system.
data.HPO_term_synonyms: NA

data.HPO_term_definition: Moderate mental retardation is defined as an intelligence quotient (IQ) in the range of 35-49.
data.HPO_term_synonyms: Moderate mental deficiency, IQ between 34 and 49, Mental retardation, moderate, Moderate mental retardation

data.HPO_term_definition: Loss of developmental skills, as manifested by loss of developmental milestones.
data.HPO_term_synonyms: Loss of developmental skills, as manifested by loss of developmental milestones

data.HPO_term_definition: An organ or organ-system abnormality that consists of uncontrolled autonomous cell-proliferation which can occur in any part of the body as a benign or malignant neoplasm (tumour).
data.HPO_term_synonyms: Cancer, Tumour, Abnormal tissue mass, Tumor, Neoplasia, Oncology, Oncological abnormality

data.HPO_term_definition: An abnormality of the immune system.
data.HPO_term_synonyms: Immunological abnormality, Abnormality of the immune system

data.HPO_term_definition: Abnormality originating in one or more muscles, i.e., of the set of muscles of body.
data.HPO_term_synonyms: Muscular abnormality

data.HPO_term_definition: NA
data.HPO_term_synonyms: Worsens with time, Progressive disorder

data.HPO_term_definition: A height below that which is expected according to age and gender norms. Although there is no universally accepted definition of short stature, many refer to "short stature" as height more than 2 standard deviations below the mean for age and gender (or below the 3rd percentile for age and gender dependent norms).
data.HPO_term_synonyms: Decreased body height, Small stature, Stature below 3rd percentile, Height less than 3rd percentile, Short stature

data.HPO_term_definition: Borderline intellectual disability is defined as an intelligence quotient (IQ) in the range of 70-85.
data.HPO_term_synonyms: Intellectual disability, borderline, Mental retardation, borderline

data.HPO_term_definition: Severe mental retardation is defined as an intelligence quotient (IQ) in the range of 20-34.
data.HPO_term_synonyms: Mental retardation, severe, Early and severe mental retardation, Intellectual disability, severe, Severe mental retardation

data.HPO_term_definition: An abnormality of the gastrointestinal tract.
data.HPO_term_synonyms: Gastrointestinal disease, Digestive system disease, Abnormality of the gastrointestinal tract, Abnormality of the GI tract

data.HPO_term_definition: The age group when the cessation of life happens.
data.HPO_term_synonyms: NA

data.HPO_term_definition: An anomaly of the mitochondrion, the membranous cytoplasmic organelle the interior of which is subdivided by cristae. The mitochondrion is a self replicating organelle that is the site of tissue respiration.
data.HPO_term_synonyms: Mitochondrial abnormalities

data.HPO_term_definition: NA
data.HPO_term_synonyms: Abnormality of limbs, Dysmelia, Abnormal limbs, Limb anomaly
